ProteinName	Diacylglycerol kinase beta (DAG kinase beta) (EC 2.7.1.107) (90 kDa diacylglycerol kinase) (Diglyceride kinase beta) (DGK-beta)
GeneName	DGKB DAGK2 KIAA0718
Length	773
Function	Diacylglycerol kinase that converts diacylglycerol/DAG into phosphatidic acid/phosphatidate/PA and regulates the respective levels of these two bioactive lipids (PubMed:11719522). Thereby, acts as a central switch between the signaling pathways activated by these second messengers with different cellular targets and opposite effects in numerous biological processes (Probable). Has a higher activity with long-chain diacylglycerols like 1,2-di-(9Z-octadecenoyl)-sn-glycerol compared to 1,2-didecanoyl-sn-glycerol (By similarity). Specifically expressed in brain, it regulates neuron-specific morphological changes including neurite branching and neurite spine formation (By similarity).
Subcellular Location	Postsynaptic cell membrane; Cell membrane; Cytoplasm; Cytoplasm
